problemStatement.formal: \text{Characterize } A,B \subseteq \mathbb{N} \text{ with } d(A), d(B) > 0 \text{ and } d(A+B) = d(A) + d(B)
problemStatement.plain: Characterize A, B ⊆ ℕ with positive density such that d(A+B) = d(A) + d(B).
whyMatters: Density additivity is a strong structural constraint
Known examples arise from torus rotations

proven: Fractional part construction: A = {n : {nθ} ∈ X_A} gives examples
open: Do ALL density-additive pairs arise from group rotations?

currentState.focus: Framework formalized with density, sumset, and fractional part construction.
